data.title: Inside the Music is a fo not miss event
data.text: Andrew Grams disects a piece, explains the story the music is telling, the history, the fokelore.. truly an amazing presentation of music. After a break, the entire piece is played as you replay the story in your head. The music comes alive. Andrew Grams is special.

data.title: Fantastic Symphony
data.text: The Elgin Symphony is a gem and never disappoints. Andrew Grams is an outstanding young director - passionate and dynamic. The Symphony is a real asset to Elgin and a "don't miss" is you're in town when the symphony is performing.

data.title: Not to be missed!!
data.text: Elgin Symphony Orchestra is simply the best. The musicians are great, and Maestro Grams is incredible. A night with ESO is both time and money well-spent.

data.title: An amazing treasure for a city with a little over 100,000 citizens
data.text: Under the baton of Andrew Grams, the symphony has exceeded all expectations. To have an organization this professional is a jewel of experience for the whole of the Fox Valley. Bravi to all its musicians.

data.title: Culture without the headaches
data.text: My sons and I have attended several concerts here -- sci-fi theme, holiday, and Copland/Shostakovich. All were excellent. Parking for the holiday concert required a walk of a couple of blocks, but everything else has required far less. Maestro Grams is quite animated. There is student pricing, so Tri-M parents, call the box office to order tickets. (Student ID required, of course.)Go and enjoy!

data.title: great music
data.text: they do a great job on each concert, they spend hours rehearsing. i love going and they are almost all sold out at every concert.

data.title: City Quality Entertainment - Free Parking!
data.text: The Elgin Symphony Orchestra, under the direction of its exciting, young musical director, is a treat!  The programming is exceptional, combining well-known classics with newer works.  The musicians are not only individually talented, they combine to create a beautiful musical experience.  The orchestra lets loose with some great holiday concerts, too.  A spooky Halloween concert, the Thanksgiving Disney concert, and of course the traditional Holiday concert are fun traditions for children and well as adults.  The reasonable ticket prices and free parking provide a high level of music (winner ofIllinois Orchestra of the Year and Musical Director of the Year!) within the reach of all.

data.title: Elgin Symphony Orchestra concerts
data.text:
The Elgin Symphony orchestra is absolutely fantastic and highly professional.
My hubbie and I have attended concerts for over 30 years. 
I highly recommend getting on their email list. They will notify you of upcoming concerts and special discounts.You can select and reserve seats online! 
Their current conductor is superb. The building also highlights local artists' work.
We highly recommend the Elgin Symphony Orchestra!

data.title: Holiday Concert
data.text: Great offerings at a reasonable price.  Very talented group that you can enjoy without the hassle of going downtown Chicago.

data.title: Paul on the Road
data.text: Fantastic orchestra.  A real value to any community.  Always a great selection of music. The ticket prices are reasonable. The only down side is that if you have a center seat, the aisles are on the end and therefore it is inconvient to reach your area.

data.title: Very Nice, and Close to Home!
data.text: We always have a wonderful time at the Elgin Symphony Orchestra concerts. It is close to home and reasonably prices, what more could you ask for.

data.title: Il Volo and the Symphony in the Park
data.text:
Great opera artists accompanied by the world class Elgin Symphony Orchestra.  The best of both musical worlds in one location.  If you get a chance to see Il Volo or the Symphony - Do It!

Packed in like sardines at the Festival Park outdoor venue is my only complaint

data.title: Just as good as any big city Symphony
data.text: Truly one of the gems of Elgin. Its wonderful Symphony plays a great selection of programs throughout the year at the Hemmens Auditorium in downtown Elgin, with classical programs, a number of Pops shows and a great Christmas program that sells out every holiday season. It would be difficult not to rank this as Elgin's #1 attraction, and it should not be missed by anyone who loves fine musical entertainment.

data.title: First rate!
data.text: The ESO is a topnotch orchestra for a small city. The playlist for this concert covered a wide range of Italian or Italian-inspired music. Ticket prices are what you'd expect for a full-size orchestra but you can usually find a deal.

data.title: Top quality performances, unpretentious, reasonable prices, easy and free parking.
data.text: The Elgin Symphony has long been a source of professional quality symphonic music in the Chicago suburbs.  The musicians are skilled, the director is talented and energetic and the music selection is diverse and lovely. They don't stick to only  the "Old Chestnuts" but it isn't all unapproachable cacophanous, avant garde music either. They feature a nice mix of classics and usually add once shorter piece to help expand some of the listener's horizon.  You don't need to go into Chicago to hear excellent live orchestral music.
